articles.title: The Arctic hasn't been this warm for 3 million years — that spells big changes for the Earth - TODAYonline
articles.description: Every year, sea ice cover in the Arctic Ocean shrinks to a low point in mid-September. This year it measures just 1.44 million square miles (3.74 million square kilometers) — the second-lowest value in the 42 years since satellites began taking measurements.
